channel.title: Home on Archives ~
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Archives ~

item.title: About
item.description:
Knowledge is fleeting if not documented. This space is an attempt to log what we study, explore, and experiment with—a growing archive of thoughts, insights, and discoveries.

Whether it’s AI/ML concepts, programming techniques, or useful resources, everything here serves as a personal reference and a guide for anyone walking a similar path.

What’s Inside? #

  • Notes on AI/ML, Python, and programming.
  • An evolving collection of resources and tools.
  • Logs of projects, ideas, and problem-solving approaches.
  • A way to look back, reflect, and improve over time.

This archive isn’t just about learning—it’s about building a habit of documenting, refining ideas, and sharing knowledge.

item.title: Resources
item.description:
• LinuxCommand.org – Learn Linux commands from here.
  • Explainshell – Get explanations for shell commands.

Git & Version Control #

  • Pro Git Book – The official Git book, free to read.
  • Learn Git Branching – Interactive Git branching exercises.
  • Oh My Git! – A gamified way to learn Git.

Python #

  • The Python Handbook – A simple yet deep guide to Python.
  • Real Python – Tutorials, courses, and practice projects.
  • Python Cheatsheet – A quick reference for Python syntax.

Machine Learning & AI #

  • Google’s Machine Learning Crash Course – A beginner-friendly introduction.
  • FastAI – Free AI/ML courses with practical projects.
  • Stanford CS231n – Stanford’s deep learning course on computer vision.
  • Kaggle Learn – Hands-on courses for data science and ML.
  • Deep Learning Specialization – Andrew Ng’s deep learning course.
